books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: In 1943, the 17-year-old Princess Charlotte assumes a new identity in the country and falls in love.

books.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

books.description: In the Black Dagger Brotherhood world, Nyx searches for her sister in a lost prison camp and meets a man known as the Jackal.
books.title: THE JACKAL

books.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

books.description: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

books.description: Ten years after her daughter disappears, a woman tries to get her life in order but remains haunted by unanswered questions.

books.description: A relationship that started in 1993 between Mallory Blessing and Jake McCloud comes to light while she is on her deathbed and his wife runs for president.

books.description: A bookseller flees Mexico for the United States with her son while pursued by the head of a drug cartel.

books.description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump. Read by the author. 7 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Sean Hannity
books.description: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election. Read by the author. 11 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: LIVE FREE OR DIE

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: James Nestor
books.description: A re-examination of a basic biological function. Read by the author. 7 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BREATH

books.author: Robin DiAngelo
books.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people. Read by Amy Landon. 6 hours, 21 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHITE FRAGILITY

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts. Read by the author. 8 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand
books.contributor: by Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand
books.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s journey from courtship to their decision to step away from their royal lives. Read by Omid Scobie. 10 hours, 29 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FINDING FREEDOM

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: S.C. Gwynne
books.description: The story of Quanah Parker, the last chief of the Comanches. Read by David Drummond. 15 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EMPIRE OF THE SUMMER MOON

books.author: Kamala Harris
books.description: A memoir by the daughter of immigrants who is now a California senator and the 2020 Democratic candidate for vice president. Read by the author. 9 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE TRUTHS WE HOLD

books.author: Stuart Stevens
books.description: The former political campaign strategist evaluates the changes within the Republican Party in the last half-century. Read by Dan John Miller. 5 hours, 37 minutes unabridged.
books.title: IT WAS ALL A LIE

books.author: Brian Stelter
books.description: The CNN anchor and chief media correspondent examines the inner workings of Fox News and its relationship with President Trump. Read by the author. 12 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOAX

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.
books.title: NEW KID

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
books.title: GUTS

books.author: Ann M Martin
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Katy Farina
books.description: After taking a tumble, Karen sets out to get her friends and someone famous to sign her cast.
books.title: BABY-SITTERS LITTLE SISTER: KAREN'S ROLLER SKATES

books.author: John Lewis and Andrew Aydin
books.contributor: by John Lewis and Andrew Aydin. Illustrated by Nate Powell
books.description: Representative John Lewis describes his childhood and the beginning of his involvement in the civil rights movement. The first volume of a trilogy.
books.title: MARCH: BOOK ONE

books.contributor: by Gerard Way. Illustrated by Gabriel Bá
books.description: When their benefactor suddenly dies, seven children with unusual superpowers reunite to save the world.

books.author: Gerard Way
books.contributor: by Gerard Way. Illustrated by Gabriel Bá
books.description: A few years after Sir Reginald Hargreeves’s death, members of the Umbrella Academy have gone in different directions.
books.title: THE UMBRELLA ACADEMY: HOTEL OBLIVION

books.author: Kohei Horikoshi
books.description: In a world full of of people who can develop superpowers, Izuku Midoriya is just a “normal” teenager. Will a chance encounter with a superhero change his fate? Most likely!
books.title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 1

books.author: Marjane Satrapi
books.description: A memoir of the author’s life from ages 6 to 14 in Iran, during and after its 1979 revolution, depicted through black-and-white comic strip images.

books.description: The fourth book in the Emmie & Friends series. A middle school girl goes outside her comfort zone.

books.contributor: by Gerard Way. Illustrated by Gabriel Bá
books.description: The loss of a beloved mentor, maniacal assassins and a plot to assassinate John F. Kennedy bedevil the trouble-laden team.

books.description: A sequel to “Strange Planet” that explores the subjects of traditions, nature, emotions and knowledge.
books.title: STRANGER PLANET

books.title: DEMON SLAYER: KIMETSU NO YAIBA, VOL. 1

books.author: Gene Luen Yang
books.description: When his family moves to the suburbs, Jin Wang wonders why he doesn’t fit in with the “all-American boys” in his new school.
books.title: AMERICAN BORN CHINESE

books.author: Junji Ito
books.description: A collection of short horror tales including “The Enigma of Amigara Fault” and an adaptation of Rampo Edogawa’s “Human Chair."
books.title: VENUS IN THE BLIND SPOT

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: A prestigious New York lawyer learns that the life she constructed for her children and herself isn't exactly what she thought it was.
books.title: CHILD'S PLAY

books.description: Past troubles resurface when a woman who unintentionally killed her half brother 20 years ago prepares for her high school reunion amid a string of potentially connected murders.

books.description: The 50th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas seeks the sender of packages that give off toxic airborne fumes.

books.description: F.B.I. Agent Drex Easton has a hunch that the conman Weston Graham is also a serial killer.

books.description: Cullen Post, a lawyer and Episcopal minister, antagonizes some ruthless killers when he takes on a wrongful conviction case.

books.description: The fifth book in the Memory Man series. The first man Amos Decker put behind bars asks to have his name cleared.
